result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (38 pages) PLEA/SENTENCING, commencing 09-11-2015, received and filed.

Defendant James P Perricone in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant James P Perricone in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing date. Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant James P Perricone in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant James P Perricone in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Victim Impact Statement received and filed. Defense counsel is not prepared to proceed. Court ordered this matter adjourned to tomorrow morning to allow the defendant additional time to review the offer. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James P Perricone in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant James P Perricone in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. This matter is following the defendant's pending felony case 15CF1423 for purposes of a global resolution. The State cannot find the DA file in this case and is unsure if victim notification has been completed. State requested an adjournment. Defense counsel does not object. Court granted State's request. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Per clerk's transfer approval.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant James P Perricone not in court, in custody and not produced to the courtroom. Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance. Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for plea date (prosecution deferred). Defendant has a pending felony in Branch 25.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25 for global resolution, per transfer approval of Deputy Court Clerk, CP.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Little Whiskey Bar 309 West National Avenue, Milwaukee, WI.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James P Perricone in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant James P Perricone in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Defense requests a Speedy Plea Date.
  Plea date scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
